description: Attaches one or more target groups to the specified Auto Scaling group. This operation is used with the following load balancer types: To describe the target groups for an Auto Scaling group, call the DescribeLoadBalancerTargetGroups API. To detach the target group from the Auto Scaling group, call the DetachLoadBalancerTargetGroups API. This operation is additive and does not detach existing target groups or Classic Load Balancers from the Auto Scaling group. For more information, see Use Elastic Load Balancing to distribute traffic across the instances in your Auto Scaling group in the Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling User Guide.

parameters.name: AutoScalingGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group.

parameters.name: TargetGroupARNs
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the target groups. You can specify up to 10 target groups. To get the ARN of a target group, use the Elastic Load Balancing DescribeTargetGroups API operation. (string) ---
